Hi Lauren,

Thanks for your advice. 

I have changed to use version 3.2.0 b=
ut I cannot seem to load https://localhost:8443 now. Our server is installe=
d in the Intranet so wondering if this could be the issue. 

Regards,
Pui S=
an 

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [mail=
to:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] 
Sent: Thursday, 8 September 2016 1:22 =
AM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] RE: Tryin=
g to run Heritrix [1 Attachment]

Some Heritrix versions run a JMX Agent on=
 a default port of 8849. The "java.net.BindException: Address already in us=
e" exception means there is already something running on port 8849 when you=
 attempt to start Heritrix, so it is not available to be used.

You could c=
heck what is running there via the commandline:
 $ lsof -i:8849

What versi=
on of Heritrix are you using? I believe the most recent Heritrix 3.X releas=
es do not use JMX, and should not need port 8849, so one option to solve yo=
ur problem might be to use Heritrix 3.2.0: https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki=
/display/Heritrix/Release+Notes+-+Heritrix+3.2.0.

If you need to use the v=
ersion of Heritrix you already have, you could specify that Heritrix use a =
different port for the JMX agent by setting the JMX_PORT environment variab=
le before running Heritrix (more info here https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki=
/display/Heritrix/HOWTO+Launch+Heritrix).

Lauren Ko
UNT Libraries
________=

Subject: [archive-crawler] Trying to run H=
eritrix

Hi,

We are trying to install and run Heritrix in Linux environmen=
t. Have installed but there is issue running Heritrix. Looking at the log f=
ile, we are seeing these errors.

Error: Exception thrown by the agent : ja=
va.rmi.server.ExportException: Port already in use: 8849; nested exception =
is:
        java.net.BindException: Address already in use

Any advice?

Th=
anks.

Regards,
Ng Pui San
